channel.title: My Skype is broke!
channel.description:
When I did the Skype update, my video calling experience went down the drain! My webcam now freezes randomly and sometimes the other persons image would freeze too.
I though that it couldn't render the image fast enough due my laptop being slow and Skype running piss slow too. This isn't a problem with other users I think.
What do you guys think the problem and solution could be?

item.title: My Skype is broke!
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Ashi:

The problem is fixed when I have task manager running! Is that weird? Help?

Maybe it has something to do with the process priority. Try changing the process priority higher and ending all unnecessary tasks. Use the performance monitor to find out whether it’s a RAM issue, bandwidth issue, CPU issue, etc. Process Explorer is a good tool, as are autoruns, both free downloads from technet.

Read full topic

profit

could be that its a virus, if it detected task manager it rm-rf myb idk

stop wanking on cam[/quote]
No no no you where wanking on cam for me but your image kept freezing!

I don’t get virus I’m too pro for that! I ain’t you. You into BBC btw??

item.title: My Skype is broke!
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Their system requirements changed recently.

For best quality we recommend you use a high-speed broadband connection of 4Mbps down / 512kbps up and a computer with a Core 2 Duo 1.8 GHz processor. As a minimum you’ll need a high-speed broad connection of 512kbps down / 128kbps up and a computer with a 1 GHz processor.

Read full topic

item.title: My Skype is broke!
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

I thought you didn’t use Skype?

On Topic… Try closing ALL programs and see if it fixes the problem, that’ll help determine whether or not it’s your computer, if that doesn’t work, completely remove Skype and any hidden files it may want to save, and re-install it. Let me know the results.

Read full topic
